content:
I removed and installed Quick Folder Move and ReplyWithHeader and they both now work. I did not install ReFwdFormatter because it appears that ReplyWithHeader does what ReFwdFormatter does plus more.

Is it expected to have to re-install Add-ons to get them to work after migration?

I still would like to know what happened to my 24 hours worth of new emails.

Thanks to anybody who can provide the answers.
creator: bkoopers

content: I have no solution, but since you have two accounts, the problem might be that they are sharing the same SMTP setup. To verify this , check that you have two distinct SMTP server setups and the 'Description' field should be unique for each. Then, check the 'account settings' pane to verify that each is linked to the appropriate SMTP server.
creator: davidsk

Can you send me which one you have for receiving and sending this?

content:
Hello there

Once you have installed the program, check whether other parties are blocking your traffic from receiving messages. This concerns your VPN software or Antivirus Software. Try to disable this and see if mail can now be received. After this, turn it on again for normal use. If you turn it off, see if you receive mail, then turn it on again and see if you now receive mail.


Greetings
creator: Googlethunderbird

content:
Hello there

Also check your file folders to see if you have lost any Imap folders if you used them.

content:
Thunderbird'ün gelişimine katkıda bulunduğunuz için teşekkür ederiz.

Thunderbird'e bağış yaptığınızda bahsettiğiniz başlangıç sayfası otomatik olarak değişmez. Bu sayfayı tekrar görmek istemezseniz Menü > Ayarlar > Genel > Thunderbird Başlangıç Sayfası > Thunderbird açıldığında ileti alanında Başlangıç Sayfasını göster ayarını kapatabilirsiniz.
creator: maxcoder

content: If you just want backup, but intend to leave accessible, my suggestion would be: - if accounts are IMAP, check 'account settings' >'syncronization&storage and verify that the folders are ticked for download/offline and also sync all messages. - Then, if accounts are IMAP click File>offline>download to ensure all messages are downloaded - next, click help>troubleshootinginformation, - scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open profile - exit thunderbird - for IMAP accounts , click Imapmail folder and copy each account folder to external media - Repeat the process at Mail folder for each POP account - Now, for any that you do not want to leave accessible, start TB and remove those accounts.
creator: davidsk

content: My experience is that 'compact folders' only compacts the highlighted folder. You might want to experiment with the addon 'xpunge' to compact all folders.
creator: davidsk

content: To create a domain name, you need to have an account with a domain registrar. A web search for that will show many such service providers, many of which also support personal email accounts.
creator: davidsk

content: The simplest way is to omit the password during setup. Although the box is there to insert it, the account will be successfully created if the server settings are correct. You can then untick boxes in server settings to check for messages, or make other preferences as desired prior to entering password.
creator: davidsk

content: My suggestion is to ignore AllMail . That is administered by Gmail and is a duplicate of the messages in other folders. Attempting to manage Allmail will fail. I always suggest unsubscribing from it.
creator: davidsk

content:
Thank you @david. As I said above, I unsubscribed "All Mail".

However, I don't want to keep my emails forever in Gmail, so I periodically go there (on the website) and delete all emails from there (because they remain there even if I already moved everything from the Inbox to the Local Folders), but once they get to the Trash, Thunderbird triggers the Message Filters.

Hence I'd like to make Message Filters apply only to Inbox.
creator: nmp5

content:
Moving messages is not the same as deleting them; that's why AllMail retains them. IMAP accounts 'own' the messages whether online or in local folders. If you want messages on PC and not online, then I suggest you make a new folder in Local Folders, then COPY desired messages there (or use filter for that), and then delete from account. That lets you have messages locally and not in Gmail.

Separately, filters just act on inbox, so you're okay there. If you have other online folders, you can rightclick and select properties and confirm that they are not checked when retrieving messages.
creator: davidsk

content:
> Separately, filters just act on inbox, so you're okay there.

Pretty sure that's not how Thunderbird behaves for me.

That's why I had to unsubscribe "All Mail" in first place. Because, Thunderbird was moving emails to Local Folders in duplicate, one from "Inbox", and another from "All Mail". And the same is happening now once it goes from "All Mail" to "Trash" (when I delete in the Gmail website, from All Mail).

> If you want messages on PC and not online, then I suggest you make a new folder in Local Folders, then COPY desired messages there (or use filter for that), and then delete from account.

Not sure I fully understood this process. But it seems a lot more complicated workflow, than just hoping that an "Apply Message Filter only to Folder:" option is implemented in Thunderbird. Or through an addon.
creator: nmp5

content: If I understand correctly, I would - create the account on new installation of thunderbird - click 'account setting' and change the link to account to point to the one on the second drive. - exit and restart thunderbird
creator: davidsk
